title: Inhibition of cytotoxic self-assembly of HEWL through promoting fibrillation by new synthesized α-hydroxycarbamoylphosphinic acids
content:
RSC Adv., 2024, 14,31227-31242
DOI: 10.1039/D4RA02969K, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported Licence.
Mohsen Mahdavimehr, Babak Kaboudin, Saied Alaie, Farimah Tondkar, Zahra Mahmoudi Eshkaftaki, Mohammad-Bagher Ebrahim-Habibi, Mojtaba Ghashghaee, Elham Tahmasebi, Tianjian Zhang, Yanlong Gu, Ali Akbar Meratan
New synthesized α-hydroxycarbamoylphosphinic acids are potent modulator of HEWL amyloid fibrillation. Shortening of the nucleation phase of HEWL leading to the acceleration of fibrillation is the proposed mechanism of action of these compounds.
